item.description: Knockdown - Brush Fire; INC#1365; 06:49PM; 22350 W Devonshire St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uyCvDa; #Chatsworth; A series of precise helicopter water drops by the first arriving LAFD helicopters stopped forward progress of the fire, which has been controlled at one-quarter (0.25) acre of light-to-medium brush near Chatsworth Park South. No injury. No structure threat or damage. All LACoFD and VCFD resources have been released, as this blaze, known as the "Sesnon Fire" is entirely within the City of Los Angeles and LAFD jurisdiction. LAFD crews will remain at the scene this evening to further control the perimeter of the fire to bare soil with hand tools. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; AO1 BC15 BC17 E104 E106 E107 E28 E290 E296 E305 E70 E8 E90 EM15 H1 H2 H5 HA1 HA2 HA5 RA96 RH114 T105 T90 + LACoFD + VCFD; CH5; 18; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#1365; 06:13PM; 22350 W Devonshire St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uyCvDa; #Chatsworth; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response with the Los Angeles County and Ventura County Fire Departments to one-quarter (0.25) acre light-to-medium brush burning uphill in Chatsworth Park South, in 5-10 mph winds from north. No structure threat.; FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 BC17 E106 E107 E28 E296 E305 E70 E8 E90 EM15 H1 H2 HA1 HA2 RA96 T105 + LACoFD + VCFD; CH5; 18; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 07/08/2022 INC#0154

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0154; 03:56AM; 8124 S Western Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3InF68J; #ManchesterSquare; *Address Remains Tentative* 87 Firefighters took just 53 minutes in well-coordinated defensive firefighting operations, to access, confine and full extinguish heavy fire within a vacant 50' x 150' one story commercial building. No injury. title.a: Update Fatality Traffic Collision with Entrapment FINAL - 07/06/2022 INC#0475

item.description: Update FINAL - Fatality Traffic Collision with Entrapment; INC#0475; 09:58AM; 20100 W Parthenia St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3bNTLOl; #Winnetka; 2 vehicles. 3 patients total = 17 year-old male driver of overturned vehicle, deceased at scene. An approximately 20 year-old male passenger in that vehicle, was taken to an area hospital by LAFD Paramedics in critical condition with unspecified injuries. The third patient, from the other vehicle, was an approximately 40 year-old female found curbside with minor injuries. She has declined ambulance transportation. #LATraffic: The intersection of Parthenia Street and Winnetka Avenue is closed to all traffic until the LAPD investigation is complete, unknown duration. Motorists, expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Detours are readily available. Monitor traffic reports on news radio. Transit Users: Follow @MetroLAAlerts https://twitter.com/MetroLAAlerts on Twitter for any service related information. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #1430) and Coroner.; FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E103 E104 E107 E273 E296 EM15 HR3 RA104 RA107 RA872 RA96 T73 T96 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Fatality Traffic Collision with Entrapment 07/06/2022 INC#0475

item.description: Fatality Traffic Collision with Entrapment; INC#0475; 09:40AM; 20100 W Parthenia St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3bNTLOl; #Winnetka; Two vehicle collision with a total of 3 patients, including two trapped in an overturned vehicle on LAFD arrival. One of the trapped persons proved beyond medical help, was determined dead and remains at the scene. The other trapped person was freed by firefighters and has been taken to an area hospital in undetermined condition. The third patient, found curbside with minor injuries, is declining ambulance transportation. No information currently available on age / gender / condition / affiliation / circumstances. #LATraffic: Closure of one or more lanes at or near the intersection of Parthenia Street and Winnetka Avenue until the LAPD investigation is complete, unknown duration. Motorists, expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Detours are readily available. Monitor traffic reports on news radio. Transit Users: Follow @MetroLAAlerts https://twitter.com/MetroLAAlerts on Twitter for any service related information. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #1430) and Coroner. ; FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E103 E104 E107 E273 E296 EM15 HR3 RA104 RA107 RA872 RA96 T73 T96 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey
